item.title: Read Last Week - Everybody loves Facebook !
Read last week - Cambridge Analytica
item.description: BBC on Cambridge Analytica Tech giant Facebook and data analytics firm Cambridge Analytica are at the centre of a dispute over the harvesting and use of personal dat BGR on Slingshot A nation-state developed a piece of malware so powerful that it can steal everything that’s happening on a computer without even being install on the target device itself. Instead, it resides on a router. It’s called Slingshot and it was recently discovered by Kaspersky Labs.

item.title: Read last week - MoviePass
Read last week
item.description: The economist on “self driving cars” Particularly interesting is this part regarding privacy “AVs will record everything that happens in and around them. When a crime is committed, the police will ask nearby cars if they saw anything. Fleet operators will know a great deal about their riders”. Wired on China “Big Brother” Social Credits approach Kind of old news, but found it last week …“Imagine a world where many of your daily activities were constantly monitored and evaluated… It’s not hard to picture, because most of that already happens….
